name: Tina Weymouth
description: '''Martina Michèle Weymouth''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|w|eɪ|m|ə|θ}} {{respell|WAY|məth}}; born November 22, 1950) is an American musician, singer, songwriter, and a founding member and bassist of the [[New wave music|new wave]] group [[Talking Heads]] and its side project [[Tom Tom Club]], which she co-founded with her husband, Talking Heads drummer [[Chris Frantz]]. In 2002, Weymouth was inducted into the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] as a member of Talking Heads.
